Merge branch 'master' of git://github.com/timmatheson/delayed_job into timmatheson/master
Delayed_job not Delated_job

Added Module#handle_asynchronously that allows you to mark methods for async processing (Michael Koziarski)

This is useful when you have methods you want handled async in the production environment, but not require special case code.

config/environments/production.rb:

config.after_initialize do
  SomeModel.handle_asynchronously :some_method!
end

Thanks
args.second changed to args[1] (pre-2.2 compatible)
Use sort_by{rand} instead of sort{rand} for randomization as sort{rand} is of consistent outcome. Thanks Alex Ostleitner.
Made gem build on github

Merge branch 'thumblemonks/master'

Conflicts:

	lib/delayed/job.rb
Small changes in the way th egems are build
Added eval jobs as a low ceremony way of declaring jobs without an explicit class (poor man's block marshalling)
Fixed a bug that prevented jobs in sub modules from being serialized correctly
Fix for typo, also return jobs in random order to yield site to further avoid locking issues
Slightly more useful Job#name method that can easily be used for inspection

Merge branch 'master' into jbarnette/master

Conflicts:

	tasks/jobs.rake

Added min/max priority levels for workers. This allows you to have dedicated workers to high priority task
This is useful when you need to DJ a lot of tasks that need to be run quickly such as things that affect the UI like image transformations.
Dedicate some workers to high priority jobs only when you have a lot of long running low priority tasks that could otherwise clog all the workers.
add documentation and rename destroy_jobs to the more descriptive destroy_failed_jobs
test both sides of destroy_jobs behavior
whether or not jobs should be destroyed is now configurable (old jobs are destroyed by default)

Changes extracted from GitHub:

- Add failed_at to schema
- Rather than destroying a job, set its failed_at when it retries too many times.
- Take failed_at into account when finding potential jobs
- Include the backtrace in the logged last_error
- Make MAX_RUN_TIMES a constract

Job#find_available does not return running jobs

Make sure that jobs that have not expired are not being returned by
Job#find_available.
allow Delayed::PerformableMethod to work with class methods.  Foo.send_later :process, id
merge

Refactored jobs:work, added jobs:clear.

  - added Rake descriptions
  - factored jobs:work into Delayed::Worker for reuse in scripts
  - updated the README to suggest using Delayed::Worker.new.start

Removed the global lock. Jobs can now processed in parallel by running multiple job runners on the same machine or across your server farm.
This requires two new columns in the job table: locked_by and locked_until
